Diagnosis
	1. Poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma with lung and bone metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Total thyroidectomy and central neck dissection

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Systemic therapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive metastatic disease

	Current issues
	Breathlessness, bone pain, fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	This 68 year old gentleman presents with recently diagnosed poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma. Following thyroidectomy on 15/3/24, histology confirmed a 6.5cm poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma with extensive vascular invasion and extracapsular extension. 4/6 central compartment nodes were positive. Molecular analysis has confirmed TERT promoter mutation.

Staging CT on 28/3/24 demonstrated multiple bilateral pulmonary metastases, the largest measuring 2.8cm, and widespread bone metastases including T8 vertebral body with 40% height loss. MRI spine on 2/4/24 confirms impending cord compression at T8 level.

He describes progressive breathlessness over 6 weeks, now limiting mobility to 20 meters. He has severe thoracic back pain requiring regular oxycodone. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2-3.

On examination, there is no palpable neck disease. Chest examination reveals reduced breath sounds bilaterally with right base crepitations. There is marked tenderness over T8 vertebra.

Past medical history includes poorly controlled type 2 diabetes (latest HbA1c 86), hypertenshion, and atrial fibrilation. Current medications include Lantis insulin, metformin, ramipiril, apixxaban, and osycodone MR.

	Further investigations
	Thyroglobulin and thyroglobulin antibodies
TFTs
Urgent MRI brain

	Medication prescribed
	Levothyroxine 100mcg daily
Dexamethasone 8mg bd

	Follow up
	Urgent clinical oncology review for emergency radiotherapy to T8
Review in endocrine oncology clinic in 1 week with results

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood glucose given high dose steroids
Weekly blood pressure monitoring
Urgent district nurse referral for support at home
